quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Georgia
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, blues. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What novelty song was made famous by John  Ernest, the duo that brought us the song, Soul President Number 1?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Superfly Meets Shaft

questions.question: What novelty song, written by Barry Cryer, was performed by Sheb Wooley?

options.text: Itsy Bitsy Teenie Weenie Yellow Polka-Dot Bikini

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Purple People Eater

questions.question: Which of these relatives did Ernie K. Doe sing about in 1961?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mother-In-Law

questions.question: Who wrote the melody of The Devil Went Down to Georgia originally, and called it Lonesome Fiddle Blues?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vassar Clements

questions.question: Which one of these groups, named after a part of the body, sing the song No Matter What?

options.text: Wings (Only if you are an angel)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Badfinger

questions.question: In what year did the song The Devil Went Down to Georgia come out?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1979

questions.question: Which of these is the name of the song by Salsoul Orchestra?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Night Crawler

questions.question: What T.V. show did a recreation of the song The Devil Went Down to Georgia in one of its episodes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Muppets

questions.question: What does Johnny do after he beats the Devil in the song The Devil Went Down to Georgia?

options.text: He tells the Devil hell never be a good fiddler.
He begins to play the golden fiddle he won.
He challenges the Devil to come back another time for a rematch.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He challenges the Devil to come back another time for a rematch.

questions.question: Robert John and this group of Brooklyn, New York made the song The Lion Sleeps Tonight famous.

options.text: Rick Dees  His Cast of Idiots

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Tokens

questions.question: Which are the two groups that made the song Alley-Oop famous in 1960?

options.text: Dante  The Evergreens / The Hollywood Argyles
The Holly wood Argyles / The Trashmen
The Hollywood Argyles / The Undisputed Truth

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dante  The Evergreens / The Hollywood Argyles

questions.question: Which of these was never a novelty hit for the funny Dickie Goodman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Space 1999

questions.question: Does Johnny play his fiddle first in The Devil Went Down to Georgia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: In the song The Devil Went Down to Georgia, the Devil challenges a young man Johnny to a fiddle playing contest. At first, Johnny is reluctant to take the bet, afraid that hell lose his soul.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The Clovers and The Searchers both shared the credit for singing this hit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Love Potion # 9

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Band
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, gon, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The song heard in the audio clip became the only hit single for this group in 1970.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guitar

questions.question: This singer/guitarist released the song Poetry Man in 1975.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phoebe Snow

questions.question: This Philadelphia group is best known for the song featured in the audio clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Three Degrees

questions.question: This band released Whatcha Gonna Do? in 1976, a  single from their A Place in the Sun album which reached #6 on the Billboard charts.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pablo Cruise

questions.question: His song Lonely Boy begins with the lyrics He was born on a summer day, 1951.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Gold

questions.question: God Gave Rock n Roll to You was originally recorded by this band (before it became a hit for Kiss).  However, their biggest hit was Hold Your Head Up.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Argent

questions.question: This porn star released More, More, More (Pt. 1) which went to #4 on the Billboard pop charts.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrea True

questions.question: This former Fleetwood Mac member released Sentimental Lady in 1977.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Welch

questions.question: The 1974 song heard in the audio clip was this artists only top forty hit as a solo artist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rick Derringer

questions.question: Id Love You to Want Me and the song featured in the audio clip were successful recordings by this artist in the 1970s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lobo

questions.question: Charlie Daniels was nominated for a Grammy Award for Best Country Vocal Performance in 1979 for The Devil Went Down to Georgia but did not win.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This band heard in the audio clip had a few hits from 1970-71 with songs such as Get Ready, but didnt achieve significant success afterwards.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rare Earth

questions.question: This artist released a 1974 hit song describing a romance in the Arabian peninsula.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maria Muldaur

questions.question: What is the title of the sequel to the song The Devil Went Down to Georgia.

options.text: The Devil Comes Back to Georgia
The Devil Is Back in Georgia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Devil Comes Back to Georgia

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Mozart and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, college, products. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This winner of the second season of American Idol had a hit song called Sorry 2004.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ruben Studdard

questions.question: This American Idol finalist had a huge hit in 2004 with Since U Been Gone.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kelly Clarkson

questions.question: How many siblings did Mozart have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 sister, no brothers

questions.question: This American Idol star had a big hit song on the charts called Inside Your Heaven.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bo Bice

questions.question: After the name of a Mozart work, a K and a number often appear. What does this catalog number mean?

options.text: An attempt to put all his work in order of popularity at the time of his death.
An attempt to list all his work in order.
An attempt to list the serial number for his original manuscripts.
An attempt to grade the greatness of his work.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An attempt to list all his work in order.

questions.question: How old was Mozart when he wrote his first composition?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Five and a half

questions.question: This American Idol contestant finished 4th in Season 5 and had his own band take off in a big way in 2006. One of their songs is Its Not Over.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chris Daughtry

questions.question: Which of these statements regarding Mozart is definitely  true?

options.text: Mozart never performed outside Continental Europe.
Mozart lived to be 72  years old

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mozart survived smallpox

questions.question: The manufacturers of which of these products have used Mozarts music in their commercials?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cheer detergent

questions.question: This American Idol winner had a huge hit song in 2004 called I Believe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fantasia Barrino

questions.question: Mozarts father was kicked out of college.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The first piece Mozart learned was a scherzo by G.C. Wagenseil, when he was about three and a half. How long did it take for him to learn it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 30 minutes

questions.question: This American Idol contestant has gone on to be a successful country singer in his own right. He had a #1 song on the Country charts with Nothin to Lose.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Josh Gracin

questions.question: Which statement is true about  Mozarts date and place of birth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mozart was born 1/27/1756 in Salzburg

questions.question: Which of these was Mozarts name at birth ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johannes Chrystomus Wolfgang Theophilus Mozart
